thread.title: Families of Britons in Tunisia terrorist attack will sue | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Families of Britons in Tunisia terrorist attack will sue | Daily Mail Online

author: Martin Robinson
title: Families of Britons in Tunisia terrorist attack will sue | Daily Mail Online
text: show ad Tunisia beach massacre coroner blasts 'cowardly' police and clears travel company of blame - but families of Britons murdered by ISIS gunman say they'll sue Inquest into deaths of 30 Britons at the Royal Courts of Justice comes to end and all were 'unlawfully killed' Seifeddine Rezgui opened fire at the five-star Riu Imperial Marhaba Hotel after murdering people on beach 'Part of attack or most of it could have been prevented' and one claimed travel agent said it was '100% safe' But coroner Judge Loraine-Smith refused plea that TUI travel company 'neglected' the victims He told family police were cowards and said: 'You've shown dignity for which your loved ones would be proud' Families confirmed that they will sue holiday firm Tui, which runs Thomson Holidays and First Choice Published: 10:53 GMT, 28 February 2017 | Updated: 17:32 GMT, 28 February 2017 90 shares
